About Draw-String

Draw-String is meant to mimic a meeting place white board. All users viewing the same drawing will see live updates as anyone manipulates the drawing. All drawings are saved for future use and/or manipulation. The app requires browsers > IE8 that support 'canvas'. It was built primarily to explore some of the newer technologies and tools.

App details

  • The app sits on a MEAN stack (Mongo/Express/Angular/Node)
  • It uses Fabric.js for shapes
  • Socket.io for websocket management.
  • The shapes/canvas are serialized to json and saved in the mongodb (via mongoose).
  • The fabric.js shapes have been extended to allow for adding a unique id to each (created using mongodb._id).

Development

  • The development was done using WebStorm IDE.
  • Obviously, NPM for node dependencies
  • It uses GruntJs for a task runner.
  • Bower for web dependencies
  • Grunt live-reload monitors the file system for code changes and automatically reloads the file into the browser via websockets.
  • Nodemon monitors the file system for nodejs server changes and reloads them to the running instance of node.
  • Various other Grunt tasks build a distribution of the applications where javascript is combined/minified/uglified and rewrites references in index.html appropriately.
